Prehistory is a long, long time ago, before people wrote down their stories and histories. During prehistory, humans lived on Earth and created tools, hunted animals, and grew food. They also made art, like paintings and carvings, and built homes. People moved around, searching for food and shelter. Some groups of humans were nomadic, traveling from place to place, while others settled in one spot and built more permanent homes. We know about prehistory by studying the things they left behind, like fossils, tools, and artifacts. These clues help us learn about the lives of people who lived before written history.
